title: Font (minimal calligraphy)
content:
hey, I'm looking for the font used in the picture. just a small example, sorry!

thank you very much!

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Picture 21.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20130621113432/http:/typophile.com/files/Picture%2021_2.png) | 13.06 KB |
author: sub

comments.content: This may be predigital or lettering. The 'e' reminds me of [Globe Gothic](http://web.archive.org/web/20130621113432/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/lanston_type/ltc_globe_gothic_regular/?sample_text=jetzt&sample_size=74&acs_p=1&acs_pt=24&acs=1).

No, this certainly is from [Süddeutsche Zeitung Magazin](http://web.archive.org/web/20130621113432/http:/sz-magazin.sueddeutsche.de/), right?  
(Always mention your source, David! :°)  
This Munich based newspaper has had this distinctive nameplate ( [discussed](http://web.archive.org/web/20130621113432/http:/www.typophile.com/node/31857) here [previously](http://web.archive.org/web/20130621113432/http:/www.typophile.com/node/33764)) for more than 60 years now.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20130621113432im_/http:/typophile.com/files/sz_6663.png)
  
A few years ago, the letterforms of that lettered nameplate were turned into a font, missing characters were added. I once read about that, but unfortunately forgot who had done it.

[SZM](http://web.archive.org/web/20130621113432/http:/sz-magazin.sueddeutsche.de/) is a weekly supplement to the paper. [Mirko Borsche](http://web.archive.org/web/20130621113432/http:/www.mirkoborsche.com/) used to be its art director for the last three years … I don’t know if he was involved.

[Typeforum.de](http://web.archive.org/web/20130621113432/http:/www.typeforum.de/modules.php?op=modload&name=XForum&file=viewthread&tid=451) doesn’t know either … guess it’s time to ask directly.

By the way, ‘jetzt’ was the name of another Süddeutsche supplement – its weekly teenager magazine, in print from 1993–2002. There’s still an [online edition](http://web.archive.org/web/20130621113432/http:/jetzt.sueddeutsche.de/). David, do you know how old your sample is?

thanks florian. yes, you are right.  
my mistake, didn't thought that it could be the sueddeutsche type.

I think it's part of a redesign of the jetzt magazin (found it on the portfolio website of mirko borsche ( [http://www.mirkoborsche.com/](http://web.archive.org/web/20130621113432/http:/www.mirkoborsche.com/ "http://www.mirkoborsche.com/") -\> work, jetzt II)
